title: FPGA-Based Deep Learning System Implementation Project

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: FPGA hands-on training program conducted via smartphone-based mobile learning platforms and limited PC resources. Designed for teachers, requiring integration of theory and practice

learning_goals: Implementation of deep learning layers (Convolution, Max-Pooling, etc.) using High-Level Synthesis (HLS) on FPGA platforms

Learners compare three core differences (parallel processing efficiency, resource utilization, latency) between N-Fold and Flow architectures and propose two optimization strategies (pipeline optimization, resource allocation planning) under given hardware constraints (CPU/GPU specs, memory capacity).

Learners design lightweight deep learning models for image classification or speech recognition using TensorFlow Lite or ONNX Runtime on resource-constrained devices (e.g., Raspberry Pi 4, Jetson Nano: 4-core CPU, â‰¤4GB RAM) and validate a system achieving real-time performance (>30FPS) with inference latency <100ms.

Learners will develop an FPGA-based deep learning system prototype through a team project consisting of four members and submit deliverables meeting the following criteria at the end of the six-month course: 1) Achieve inference accuracy of 85% or higher on the MNIST or CIFAR-10 dataset, 2) Utilize FPGA resources at 70% or higher efficiency, 3) Prepare a 15-page technical report (including methodology, experimental results, and limitations).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
